marketNews.title: Base Metals Heat Up, Nickel Breaks US$21,000/ton
marketNews.content:
Base metals have surged in the past week. According to the London Metal Exchange (LME) three-month futures, nickel rose 11.2% week-over-week (WoW) to US$21,080 per metric ton, copper rose 6.6% WoW to US$10,668 per ton and tin rose 6.7% WoW to US$34,251 per ton.

Factors supporting the rally include:
- Slowing U.S. inflation – U.S. inflation for April 2024 slowed to 3.4% year-over-year (YoY) versus 3.5% YoY in March, matching consensus expectations. This ends a three-month streak of readings above consensus and revives expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut in 2024, potentially boosting economic activity and demand for base-metal commodities.
- China’s stimulus – On 17 May 2024 the Chinese government began issuing yuan-denominated bonds worth 1 trillion yuan (US$138 billion) to stimulate key sectors of its economy. The stimulus could lift Chinese economic activity and provide a positive sentiment for global commodity prices.
- Supply-disruption concerns – Riots in New Caledonia, the world’s third-largest nickel producer, have raised fears of a supply disruption for global nickel.
- Delays in Indonesian mining permits – The approval process for mining work plans (RKAB) remains slow. The government is reported to have provided no update on nickel RKAB status for the past two months. As of the end of March 2024, only 15 tin-mine RKABs had been approved. This could disrupt production. Indonesia accounts for an estimated 50% of global nickel production, 18% of global tin production and 4% of global copper production (U.S. Geological Survey, 2023).

Key Takeaway
The rise in base-metal prices could lift average selling prices (ASP) and potentially increase margins for producing issuers.

In the past week, the proxy issuers for these commodities appreciated as follows:
- Nickel: $MBMA (+15.18%), $INCO (+14.19%), $ANTM (+8.88%), $NCKL (+6.19%)
- Copper: $AMMN (+6.6%), $MDKA (+2.53%)
- Tin: $TINS (+4.3%)

marketNews.title: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi Dies in Helicopter Crash
marketNews.content: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi died in a helicopter crash in the mountains near the Azerbaijan border on Sunday, 19 May 2024.

marketNews.title: Gas Price Policy (HGBT) Raises Costs for Seven Industrial Sectors
marketNews.content: According to Kontan, seven industrial sectors that receive a specific natural-gas price (HGBT) of US$6 per MMBtu must pay a higher gas price due to a sharp supply drop from Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS). The chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association, Edy Suyanto, said the national ceramic industry must pay an average gas price of US$9.44-10 per MMBtu because of limited PGAS supply. The chairman of the Gas Users Forum, Yustinus Gunawan, warned that the cheap-gas quota from PGAS could push de-industrialisation.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports 6.8% YoY Same-Store Sales Growth in April 2024
tickerNews.content: Ace Hardware Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.8% year-over-year in April 2024 (versus +19.9% YoY in March 2024 and +15% YoY in April 2023), with indicative sales of IDR 763 billion. The growth occurred across all regions: Jakarta +4.1%, Java outside Jakarta +6.9% and outside Java +8.2%. Over the four-month period to April 2024, ACES posted SSSG of +11.4% YoY on indicative sales of IDR 2.7 trillion. Management targets SSSG growth of +7% YoY for 2024.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Announces Authorized-Capital Reduction of 3.84%
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia plans to reduce its authorized capital by buying back approximately 1.23 billion treasury shares, equal to 3.84% of its paid-in capital. The move aims to enhance shareholder value and create a more efficient capital structure. After the transaction, paid-in capital will fall from roughly IDR 3.2 trillion to about IDR 3.08 trillion. The plan was approved at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 15 May 2024.

tickerNews.title: PSSI Declares IDR 251.1 Billion (48 IDR) Dividend for FY 2023
tickerNews.content: IMC Pelita Logistik announced a dividend for fiscal year 2023 of IDR 251.1 billion, or IDR 48 per share. The ex-dividend date and payment date have not been announced. Based on a share price of IDR 478 on Monday 20 May, the implied dividend yield is about 10%.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Approves Up to IDR 5.4 Billion Private Placement
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Impack Pratama Industri approved a private-placement of up to approximately IDR 5.4 billion (10% of the company’s shares) with a maximum dilution of 8.03%. Corporate Finance Manager Nixon Randy Wisata said the assumed issue price is around IDR 346 per share, or about IDR 1.9 trillion in total. The proceeds will be used for capital expenditures, business development including acquisition opportunities, working capital and long-term loan repayment. The company is still seeking a strategic investor for the transaction.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Reports 37% MoM Decline in Cement Sales in April 2024
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia reported cement sales of 2 million tonnes in April 2024, a decline of 37% month-over-month and 8.9% year-over-year. Sales from Indonesian facilities fell to 1.8 million tonnes (-38% MoM, -8.5% YoY) while sales from Vietnamese facilities fell to 131 thousand tonnes (-17.6% MoM, -15.2% YoY). Over the four-month period to April 2024, total sales were down 3.4% YoY to about 11.1 million tonnes.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Shareholder Arthakencana Rayatama Increases Stake to 61.20%
tickerNews.content: PT Arthakencana Rayatama, the controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, purchased approximately 24.7 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,619 per share between 8 May and 16 May 2024. The total transaction value was about IDR 40.1 billion, raising its ownership from 61.08% to 61.20%.

tickerNews.title: BSDE, Astra Land and Hongkong Land Launch Navapark High-End Residential Project
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) together with Astra Land Indonesia and Hongkong Land formed a joint venture on 30 April 2024 to develop the Navapark high-end residential project covering about 80 hectares in BSD City. The partners previously collaborated in 2023 on a roughly 70-hectare township project in Cibubur.

tickerNews.title: TLKM’s Telkomsat Signs Starlink Business-Service Agreement
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia, through its subsidiary PT Telkom Satelit Indonesia (Telkomsat), signed a cooperation agreement with SpaceX’s Starlink to provide business-grade services using the Starlink satellite network. The partnership builds on a 2021-2022 collaboration for back-haul connectivity and satellite-landing rights.

tickerNews.title: Luhut Claims Elon Musk Is Considering Building an EV-Battery Plant in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Indonesia’s Minister of Coordinating Maritime and Investment Affairs Luhut B. Pandjaitan said that Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk is considering a proposal to build an electric-vehicle battery factory in Indonesia. Musk has not responded to the claim. Musk attended the Starlink launch event at the World Water Forum in Bali on Sunday 19 May.
